Text:
Led by Gamma, "Luna Ltd." acquired shares of an
existing business in Midgar and, in addition to the
distribution of fashion for nobles, has opened stalls
across the capital for its new venture—Tuna King.

This new venture is doing exceptionally well, and the
Garden's income has continued to increase.

A net profit of 25 million zeni per month... Compared
to the 4 million zeni when it was just fashion, that's
already a phenomenal rate of growth.

It's just like Gamma to go for name recognition by
reinforcing the fashion business and targeting
deep-pocketed nobles as future customers,
instead of spending to expand "Tuna King."

The production of a new clothing line for nobles is
in its final stages, and the company plans to deliver
"menswear" to some of the more fashionable nobles
at the start of next season...
...Is something on your mind, Beta?
N-No—Well, a little.

Would you like to talk about it? I won't force you,
of course, if you're not comfortable.
Lady Alpha...

...Well, all the others are playing active roles
while I've just been sat here doing menial
office work.

Of course, I know this work is essential, and I'm
good at what I do, but...

You feel frustrated because Gamma, Zeta, and Eta are
achieving results in their areas of expertise.
...Yes.

In that case, Beta, I have the perfect job for you.
It may be challenging, but would you like to give it
a shot?
Well...it depends on the job.
You don't feel confident?

Well, um, I can fight! I used to struggle, but now I
can hold my own!

Heheh. Don't worry. What I'm about to ask you won't
require fighting or exploring.

Oh...right. Guess if you wanted someone purely
for their fighting skills, you'd ask Delta instead.

Exactly. I can ask you to take on this job because you
know what you're good at and where your strengths lie.
Well, Lady Alpha, what's this job you have for me?

(Lady Alpha wants me to secure a new source of intel
in the Sacred Land of Lindwurm.)

(The headquarters of Midgar's oldest information
guild, the MNA—the Midgar Newspaper
Association—is based in this city.)

(My job will be to find a foothold into accessing the
MNA's intel-gathering capabilities and archives
without giving away the Garden's existence).

You expect way too much from me, Lady Alpha! And
don't patronize me with your "Don't worry, I believe
in you" nonsense!

It's typical of someone who excels at everything to
assume others are capable of what they can do!

(Boo-hoo... What am I doing? Ranting on about it
won't change anything.)

(I need to start coming up with ways for the Shadow
Garden to infiltrate the MNA.)
(That's why I came all this way to Lindwurm!)

(The MNA is a long-established newspaper association
that has consistently maintained a neutral position
toward kingdom politics since its inception.)

(And according to Zeta's intel, it has no ties to
the Cult of Diablos.)

(How can I gather intel from such an influential
newspaper association in a way that doesn't involve
forceful tactics or espionage?)

(No point in hiding my identity and joining as a
journalist-in-training if it'll mean neglecting my
work in the Garden...)

(If only there were a convenient position where I
could freely walk in and out of the MNA, taking
whatever intel I want with me.)
*sigh*

(I feel like a regular person, just reading their
newspaper in a street corner cafe.)

(Heheh... I'm like Master Shadow working under a
false identity.)

(Oh... Maybe Lady Alpha gave me this job because she
knows I idolize Master Shadow when he's in disguise.)
...I'm probably overthinking it...huh?

"Midgar Newspaper Association Seeks Writer for
Serial Novels"...?

A serial writer... I wonder what the pace of
serialization is like.

(A writer, huh? Well, I guess it's unrelated to this
mission—)

(A position where I could freely walk in and out of
the MNA, taking whatever intel I want with me...)
...Hold on...

(Doesn't a serial writer for the MNA...fit the bill
exactly?!)

(A serial writer would obviously have free access to
the MNA and likely to past records under the guise
of research.)

(So it's not only related to the role...but it's kind
of ideal!)

(Wow, a writer... I'm sure that would be a lovely
profession.)
